results.title: Indonesia: the land and the people
results.brief_description: A survey of the Republic of Indonesia, including its geographical location, weather, soil, and agriculture. Mention is made of the population, of the different religions, languages, and crafts; the unique life with dancing and music daily, the use of the market place, and the cluster of homes of members of one clan. Products of the country are pictured and stress placed on importance of foreign trade.

results.title: Indonesia: pressure of population
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Oliver Howes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of Indonesia”.
Indonesia is the world’s largest Muslim country and the fifth most populous nation. This program shows different aspects of the effect of this huge, but unequally distributed population, on the lives of individuals. “Debra Yatim: journalist” describes this young journalists attempt to bring to public notice the plight of the Djarkata poor. “Two doctors” follows two young doctors serving their compulsory term in some of Indonesia’s most remote communities, and the education and self-help program they are putting in place. “The Sannarto family” follows the fortunes of an urban family taking part in a resettlement program designed to develop Indonesia’s outlying provinces, and the difficulties this produces both for the migrating families and for the indigenous population. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: Indonesia: new nation of Asia
results.creator_credit: William Deneen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: An Indonesian teacher tells the story of his country. Traces the history of Indonesia from Dutch rule to independence; shows life in crowded cities and in the home of village families; examines the natural resources, religions, art and industries of the country, pointing out how living standards are improving.

results.title: Indonesia builds a better life
results.brief_description: Indonesia, since gaining independence, has begun a series of new developments. Thousands of men and women are being taught to read and write as part of a campaign to eradicate illiteracy. An attempt is being made to control the spread of the disease Framboesia, commonly known as yaws. Those already suffering from the disease are given on the spot treatment. While this medical attention is being given research workers are constantly checking its results, and reporting to the World Health Organisation.

results.title: Indo-Australia cricket tests, 1964
results.brief_description: A survey of the tour of India by the Australian Test Team in 1964. Shows highlights of the matches played in various cities and the personalities associated with the tour. A very successful series of matches which drew large and enthusiastic crowds.

results.title: Individualised instruction
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre, University of New South Wales and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Considers the use of tape-slide combinations as a strategy for teaching large undergraduate classes. Two methods of utilisation are discussed. Considers underlying principles such as feedback and student participation, the practicalities of cost and program construction, and attempts to evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of this medium.

results.title: Individual progress in reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Reading Development”.
Examines the provision for individual progress in reading at two American schools. Two reading improvement specialists are seen operating different aspects of their respective reading programs. The schools are located on airbases in Oxfordshire.

results.title: Individual differences & developmental milestones
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Traces the course of sensorimotor development over the first year. Examines the results of comtemporary research on temperament, auditory and visual acuity, depth perception, phonemic discrimination and cross-modality matching. Presents newborns as they confront situations that allow them to exhibit their capacity to act, learn and remember.

results.title: Individual differences
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Educational Psychology”.
The case study of a shy, slow child, who is different from his classmates and from his older, socially-adept brother, whose reputation is a constant reminder of his own shortcomings. Everyone needs to succeed, the film points out, and most of all those in terms of individual interests and capabilities. It is the job of the school to shape education to these individual needs.
